page.title: 21Cossham Hospital Update
page.content:
Cossham Hospital was under threat of closure after Labours decision to downgrade local hospitals but after a lot of protest from the community it was annouced, in the April of 2008, Cossham will receive Â£19 million refurbishment. Work was scheduled to begin on the main hospital building in April 2010. The estimated number of patient visits to Cossham will grow from 70,000 in 2008/09 to 175,000 in 2012/13. It will include:

- A minor injury service open 7 days a week

- Diagnostics including MRI and CT scanners as well as X-ray and ultrasound

- The only 'stand alone' birthing centre in South Glos. and Bristol

- Therapy services including physiotherapy and audiology

- Podiatry and special care dental service

- New cafe and community hall

- Parking spaces, Disabled spaces and large 'drop-off' area close to the front door

- Conservation and repair of these grade ll listed buildings

Subject to approval, North Bristol Trust plan to convert the stable block to provide a Satellite Renal Dialysis Unit
Anne Trego
